[[File:Solar panels.jpg|thumb|Solar panels at [[Armenian National Agrarian University]], [[Yerevan]]]] '''[[Solar energy]]''' is widely available in [[Armenia]] due to its geographical position and is considered a developing industry.
According to the [[Ministry of Energy Infrastructures and Natural Resources (Armenia)|Ministry of Energy Infrastructures and Natural Resources of Armenia]],<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.minenergy.am/page/416|title=Արևային էներգետիկա - էներգետիկա - www.minenergy.am|last=|first=|date=|website=www.minenergy.am|publisher=Ministry Of Energy Infrastructures and Natural Resources Of The Republic Of Armenia|language=Armenian|access-date=2016-12-01}}</ref> Armenia has an average of about 1720 [[kilowatt hour]] (kWh) solar energy flow per square meter of horizontal surface annually and has a potential of 1000 MW power production.<ref>{{cite web|title=Solar Energy|url=http://www.minenergy.am/en/page/416|website=Ministry of Energy of Armenia|accessdate=9 December 2016}}</ref> In the capital [[Yerevan]], the average solar energy flux is equal to 1642 kWh/m<sup>2</sup>.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://gea.am/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Արևային-կայանների-կիրառումը.pdf|title=Արևային-կայանների-կիրառումը|last=|first=|date=August 2016|website=gea.am|publisher=Green Energy Association|language=Armenian|access-date=2016-12-11}}</ref> Armenia's area cannot be considered as homogeneous from the perspective of available solar energy: the difference between the amount of solar energy reaching the ground in different places in the country can be up to 20% in the summer time, and 50% in the winter time.<ref name=":0"/>
The use of solar energy in Armenia is gradually increasing.<ref name=":0" />
== Photovoltaics == [[File:Արևային վահանակներ.jpg|thumb|Solar panels on the rooftop of [[American University of Armenia]]]]{{External media|image1=[http://minenergy.am/storage/hh_taracqum_arevayin_neruji_qartezner.pdf Maps of solar irradiation maps]}} Currently 9 solar PV plants (total installed capacity – about 7,02 MW) have been put into operation. 7 companies (totally 31,5 MW) have been licensed for the construction of the solar PV plant with up tp 5 MW installed capacity.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.minenergy.am/en/page/416|title=Solar Energy - Power system - www.minenergy.am|website=www.minenergy.am|access-date=2019-05-15}}</ref>
As of February 20, 2019 Technical terms were given to 907 autonomous energy producers with capacity up to 500 kW (total capacity 12,9 MW), 854 of which have already been connected to energy system (total capacity 10,3 MW).<ref name=":2" /> Example of buildings equipped with solar panels are the [[American University of Armenia]] generating enough power for the elevators and other uses, and the [[United Nations in Armenia|UN House in Armenia]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.contact-a.am/activity.html|title=Photovoltaics|last=|first=|date=|website=www.contact-a.am|publisher=Contact-A, LLC|access-date=2016-12-11}}</ref>
A 55 MW utility-scale solar power plant will be built near [[Mets Masrik]] in [[Gegharkunik Province|Gegharkunik province]], requiring an investment of about $50 million. International tender was won by consortium of the Netherlands’ Fotowatio Renewable Ventures (FRV) B.V and Spain’s FSL Solar S.L. that are expected to commission the plant in 2020.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://arka.am/en/news/technology/frv_masrik_to_invest_28_billion_drams_in_construction_of_masrik_1_solar_power_plant/|title=FRV Masrik to invest 28 billion drams in construction of Masrik-1 solar power plant|website=ARKA News Agency|access-date=2019-05-15}}</ref><ref name=":2" />
There are defined tariffs for generating electricity using solar energy. In November 2016, Public Services Regulatory Commission of RA made a decision to set the price of electrical energy from photovoltaic systems to 42.645 [[Armenian dram|AMD]]/kWh.
Consumers are allowed to install solar panels with total power of up to 150 kW, and may sell any surplus to electricity distribution company [[Electric Networks of Armenia]] (ENA).<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://news.am/arm/news/360517.html|title=Արեւային էներգիայի համար սահմանվել է սակագին|last=|first=|date=2 December 2016|website=news.am|publisher=NEWS.am|language=Armenian|access-date=2016-12-11}}</ref>
== Thermal solar == [[File:Արևային ջեռուցիչ.jpg|thumb|Solar water heating system on the rooftop of American University of Armenia with maximum capacity of 35 kW]] In Armenia, [[solar thermal collector]]s, or water-heaters, are produced in standard sizes (1.38-4.12 square meters).<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.minenergy.am/page/416|title=Արևային էներգետիկա - էներգետիկա - www.minenergy.am|last=|first=|date=|website=www.minenergy.am|publisher=Ministry Of Energy Infrastructures and Natural Resources Of The Republic Of Armenia|language=Armenian|access-date=2016-12-11}}</ref> Solar water-heaters can be used for space heating, solar cooling, etc. In order to generate heat, they use solar energy from the Sun. Modern solar water֊heaters can cause water to boil even in winter․<ref name=":1" />
Solar thermal collectors are used throughout the territory of Armenia.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://armeniasolar.com/arm/solar|title=Արևային ջրատաքացուցիչներ {{!}} Armenia Solar|last=|first=|date=|website=armeniasolar.com|publisher=|language=Armenian|access-date=2016-12-11}}</ref> One building using solar thermal collectors is AUA, which uses solar cooling and ventilation systems. The biggest solar water-heater in Armenia is located at Diana hotel in [[Goris]], which has 1900 vacuum tubes that provide hot water for a swimming pool with 180 cubic meter volume, and for 40 hotel rooms.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://shtigen.com/%D5%A3%D5%B8%D6%80%D5%AB%D5%BD-%D5%A1%D6%80%D6%87%D5%A1%D5%B5%D5%AB%D5%B6-%D5%BB%D6%80%D5%A1%D5%BF%D5%A1%D6%84%D5%A1%D6%81%D5%B8%D6%82%D6%81%D5%AB%D5%B9/|title=Ամենախոշոր արևային ջրատաքացուցիչ Հայաստանում {{!}} Շտիգեն|last=|first=|date=|website=shtigen.com|publisher=SHTIGEN|access-date=2016-12-11}}</ref>
== Solar companies == The main companies that operate in this sector in Armenia are Solar Group Ltd, Arpi Solar Ltd, Simartek (in partnership with Solitek Armenia), Eco Step Armenia, ArtClima, General Electric Lighting Armenia (Rubinar LLC), Elips Technoline, Hatuk Santekhmontazh CJSC (SanHit Specialized Shop), Shtigen, Technoeco, Solaron (local PV panel manufacturer).<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.construction.am/suppliers.php?act=equipment&miniact=Solar%20Energy%20Equipment|title=Armenia Construction Portal|last=|first=|date=|website=www.construction.am|publisher=Construction Portal Armenia|access-date=2016-12-01}}</ref>
== Obstacles == One of the main factors preventing the development of solar energy in Armenia is the installation cost.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.panorama.am/am/news/2013/07/11/s-manukyan/481239|title=Այլընտրանքային էներգետիկայի հեռանկարների մասին|last=|first=|date=11 July 2016|website=www.panorama.am|publisher=Panorama.am|language=Armenian|access-date=2016-12-01}}</ref>
